SEARCH
Module FoundationsF25_2
Package guiUserLogin

Class ViewUserLogin

java.lang.Object
guiUserLogin.ViewUserLogin
public class ViewUserLogin extends Object

Title: ViewUserLogin Class

Description: Java/FX-based User Login Page. Provides interface for existing users to log in and for invited users to set up new accounts using invitation codes. Includes fields for username, password, invitation code, and associated buttons for actions.

Copyright: Lynn Robert Carter Â© 2025

Version:
1.00 2025-04-20 Initial version
Author:
Lynn Robert Carter

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewUserLogin

      private ViewUserLogin()

      Constructor: ViewUserLogin()

      Description: Initializes all GUI components for User Login page. Sets fonts, positions, sizes, prompts, and event handlers for all widgets. Singleton pattern is used.

  • Method Details

    • displayUserLogin

      public static void displayUserLogin(javafx.stage.Stage ps)

      Method: displayUserLogin(Stage ps)

      Description: Entry point to display the User Login page. Resets fields, removes expired invitation codes, and shows the stage.

      Parameters:
      ps - The JavaFX Stage for this GUI

    • setupLabelUI

      private void setupLabelUI(javafx.scene.control.Label l, String ff, double f, double w, javafx.geometry.Pos p, double x, double y)
      Private local method to initialize the standard fields for a label
      Parameters:
      l - The Label object
      ff - Font family
      f - Font size
      w - Label width
      p - Alignment (e.g., Pos.CENTER)
      x - X-axis position
      y - Y-axis position

    • setupButtonUI

      private void setupButtonUI(javafx.scene.control.Button b, String ff, double f, double w, javafx.geometry.Pos p, double x, double y)
      Private local method to initialize the standard fields for a button
      Parameters:
      b - The Button object to be initialized
      ff - The font to be used
      f - The size of the font to be used
      w - The width of the Button
      p - The alignment (e.g. left, centered, or right)
      x - The location from the left edge (x axis)
      y - The location from the top (y axis)
